title: Police seek suspect in $15K purse theft
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Worcester Police seek public help identifying suspect in $15,000 purse theft from Sweet Jane's Designer Consignment.
Incident occurred last week; suspect images show a person in a winter coat and hat holding items.
Police released a car photo linked to the crime; tips can be submitted by phone or text to WPD.

title: Push for more housing in Union Square hinges on zoning change
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: The Hamilton Company seeks zoning amendment for a 180-unit development in Union Square, Somerville.
Proposed buildings include two six-story mixed-use structures, combining residential, retail, and commercial spaces.
Approval required from Somerville City Council with input from the Planning Board for zoning change.

title: Hanover, Mass. woman killed while sunbathing in Florida is identified
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Anastasia Fiona Ullman, 65, was killed in Fort Pierce, Florida, when a Jeep crashed into a residential pool area.
Ullman was in Florida caring for her mother; the accident occurred on February 7, confirmed by Fort Pierre Police.
Ullman, active in Hanover, Mass., leaves behind two children and a partner of 24 years; her funeral is on Saturday.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the ‘super active’ weather pattern ahead
author: John Waller
bullets: Boston is expected to experience a 'super active' weather pattern with frequent snow and rain through early next week.
Forecasters predict snow accumulation from 1 to 3 inches on Wednesday, with roads becoming slick after dark.
A potential coastal storm is being monitored for Sunday night into Monday, which may bring additional snowfall.

title: Tiffani Faison opens new restaurant Tigerbaby at High Street Place
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Tiffani Faison's new restaurant, Tigerbaby, opened on Feb. 17 at High Street Place food hall, downtown Boston.
Tigerbaby offers a quick-service menu featuring Southeast Asian-inspired dishes like Thai basil chicken and Singapore street noodles.
Tigerbaby is Faison's fifth concept at High Street Place, alongside Bubble Bath, Charming Gardener, Dive Bar, and Tenderoni’s.

title: 6 maps predicting Wednesday’s snowfall totals
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists predict rain will switch to snow in Boston from midday Wednesday, affecting road conditions after dark.
Forecast suggests 1-3 inches of snow accumulation in Boston, with higher elevations north and west potentially receiving more.
Boston expects a narrow band of steadier snow by Wednesday evening, potentially impacting areas from north to south.

title: Former commercial building in Pittsfield is now a $325K industrial-style home for someone to ‘love’
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: Former Pittsfield commercial building at 17-19 Linden St. now listed as a $325,000 industrial-style home.
The property features three bedrooms, three bathrooms, open-concept living, exposed brick walls, and a private patio.
The distinctive 'Love' mural by Mike Carty remains a popular landmark included in Pittsfield's walking mural tour.

title: ‘Every single cage is full’: Nearly 100 cats rescued from Rhode Island hoarding situation
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Ninety-seven cats were rescued from a 1,200-square-foot apartment in Woonsocket, RI by the Rhode Island SPCA.
Some of the rescued cats are pregnant and many have colds; they are receiving medical treatment and care.
The RI SPCA is requesting donations to cover supplies and medical expenses for the rescued cats.

title: What Jarren Duran said of trade rumors, reps at DH with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jarren Duran, 29, may see more DH reps due to Red Sox's outfield competition with four impact talents.
Duran remains unfazed by trade rumors, focusing on flexibility and readiness for any role required by team.
Despite strong 2025 performance, Duran aims to improve after declining batting average and OPS last season.

title: Bruins’ Jordan Harris looking to make hockey more accessible, inclusive in Mass.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jordan Harris is enhancing hockey accessibility through the Harris' Huskies initiative with SCORE Boston.
SCORE Boston provides equipment and ice time to children lacking access to hockey, aided by NHL and Bruins Foundation.
Harris emphasizes the importance of visibility and representation in hockey through his work with young players.
